snippet: Maria Klawe, president of Harvey Mudd College in California, has helped reverse the vexing trend toward fewer women in computer science, and others are following.
abstract: Dr Maria Klawe, president of Harvey Mudd College in California, is at the forefront of an effort to help reverse a nationwide downturn in the number of women involved in computer science; an average of 22 percent of computer science graduates were women in 2005, but rate has risen to 40 percent at Harvey Mudd; Klawe credits school's success in reversing the gender gap to improvement in its introductory classes and an aggressive recruiting program.
lead_paragraph: Maria Klawe, president of Harvey Mudd College in California, has helped reverse the vexing trend toward fewer women in computer science, and others are following.
